record.id: field.name="locked.reason" and file.name="operator" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: locked.reason
record.file.name: operator

brief.brief: The reason user has been locked out of Service Manager by the System Administrator.
If the user is locked out of Service Manager, the User has been Locked? field is automatically checked (true).

detail.detail: Locked by Admin: User has been locked out by the System Administrator.
Max Failed Logins: User has reached the set maximum number of failed logins.
Account Inactivation: User account has been inactivated.

Account Expiration: User account has expired. If user is locked out for this reason, this lockout cannot be reset. A new operator record has to be added. Account Expiration is set in the System Wide Company Record.
If the user is not locked out of Service Manager, the following is displayed instead:
Not Locked: user is not locked out.
